metaDescription: Modern 3-bedroom villa in Lo Romero Golf, Pilar de La Horadada. €460,000. Perfect family home with space to grow near schools and beaches.
heroIntro:
Welcome to your family's next chapter in this beautifully appointed 3-bedroom, 3-bathroom villa in Lo Romero Golf, Pilar de La Horadada. Built across 120 square meters with an expansive 255-square-meter plot, this home offers the perfect balance of comfort and space for growing families. At €460,000, you're investing in a premium specification property that costs 40% less than comparable Spanish island markets—exceptional value for families seeking quality without compromise.

Pilar de La Horadada has become increasingly popular with international families seeking a safe, welcoming community where children can thrive and parents can enjoy Mediterranean living. This villa sits in the established Lo Romero Golf neighborhood, known for its community spirit and family-friendly atmosphere. With three generous bedrooms and three full bathrooms, there's space for everyone: master suite for parents, bedrooms for children, and room for guests. The 255-square-meter plot provides outdoor space where children can play safely, gardens can flourish, and family life can extend beyond walls.

The Costa Blanca market has experienced 8% year-on-year growth, making this an excellent time to invest in Spanish property. Whether you're seeking a permanent family residence, a holiday retreat, or a smart investment property, this villa delivers on all fronts. The established expat community means your family won't feel isolated—English is widely spoken, international schools are accessible, and support networks are already in place.
areaSection: Pilar de La Horadada sits on the southern Costa Blanca, approximately 60 kilometers south of Alicante and just 15 kilometers from the Murcia border. This strategic location offers the best of both regions without the overwhelming tourism of central Costa Blanca. The town enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually, with mild winters and warm summers—ideal for families who want Mediterranean climate without extreme heat. The area's elevation provides natural cooling breezes, while proximity to both mountains and sea creates a genuinely diverse landscape. Pilar de La Horadada has maintained its authentic Spanish character while gradually welcoming international residents, creating a balanced community where tradition and modern amenities coexist. The surrounding countryside features olive groves, almond trees, and agricultural heritage, yet infrastructure and services match modern expectations.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Pilar de La Horadada revolves around family, community, and authentic Spanish living with international convenience. Your children will attend schools with British curriculum options and international accreditation, taught by experienced educators. Mornings might start with fresh pastries from local bakeries, while evenings gather around family dinners featuring produce from weekly markets and supermarkets like Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum. The established expat community means you'll find English speakers at shops, schools, and social venues, easing the transition for newcomers. Weekends offer flexibility: drive 20 minutes to pristine Blue Flag beaches for swimming and water sports, visit championship golf courses for family lessons, or explore hilltop villages within easy driving distance. Healthcare access is comprehensive—English-speaking doctors staff private clinics, and regional hospitals provide emergency care. The pace of life remains genuinely Mediterranean: unhurried mornings, afternoon breaks, and evening paseos (walks) through town. Children benefit from safe neighborhoods, outdoor space to explore, and a community where everyone knows their neighbors.
investmentSection: From an investment perspective, this property represents smart positioning in the Costa Blanca market. The region has experienced consistent 8% year-on-year growth, with Pilar de La Horadada showing stronger appreciation than some saturated tourist areas. At €3,833 per square meter—40% below comparable Spanish island properties—you're entering at favorable pricing with upside potential. The 255-square-meter plot provides development options if circumstances change. Rental potential adds income flexibility: similar properties in the area achieve approximately €800 per week during peak season, generating €38,000-40,000 annually through short-term holiday lets. Even modest rental activity provides portfolio diversification. The established expat community ensures consistent demand for quality family properties. Whether you occupy the villa permanently, use it seasonally, or generate rental income, this investment offers multiple return pathways in a market showing healthy fundamentals.
conclusion: This villa represents more than a property purchase—it's an investment in your family's lifestyle and future. Three bedrooms, three bathrooms, and 255 square meters of private plot create the space growing families need. The €460,000 price point, 40% below comparable Spanish island markets, delivers exceptional value without compromise on quality or finishes. Market fundamentals show 8% year-on-year appreciation, with rental income possibilities adding financial flexibility. The established expat community in Pilar de La Horadada means your family won't feel isolated; English is spoken widely, international schools provide educational continuity, and support networks welcome newcomers. With Mediterranean climate, Blue Flag beaches 20 minutes away, and quality healthcare staffed by English-speaking doctors, daily life combines authentic Spanish living with international convenience. faqs.question: Сколько стоит эта недвижимость?
faqs.answer: €460,000. This includes a premium specification 3-bedroom, 3-bathroom villa built across 120 square meters with a 255-square-meter private plot. The price represents exceptional value—40% less than comparable properties in Spanish island markets while delivering superior quality and finishes.

faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. British, EU, and non-EU citizens all have identical property purchase rights. You'll need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number) and can obtain mortgage financing through Spanish banks. Many international families successfully purchase Spanish property annually.

faqs.question: Каковы расходы на покупку недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: Beyond the €460,000 purchase price, expect additional costs: transfer tax (6-10% depending on region, approximately €27,600-46,000), notary and registration fees (approximately €1,500-2,500), and legal fees (approximately €1,500-3,000). Total acquisition costs typically reach 8-12% of purchase price. Annual property tax (IBI) averages €400-800 for properties this size. These costs are lower than equivalent UK property transactions.

faqs.question: Нужна ли мне виза для покупки недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: No, purchasing property doesn't require a visa. Non-EU citizens can buy without residency. However, if you plan to live in Spain full-time, you may pursue residency visa options. The Spanish Government offers various residency pathways including the Digital Nomad visa and Residence by Investment programs.

faqs.question: Сколько составляет налог на недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) for this villa averages €400-800 depending on municipal assessments. Unlike UK council tax, this is the primary annual property tax obligation. Rental income (if you let the property) is taxed as personal income. Capital gains tax applies if you sell for profit. Overall tax burden remains considerably lower than equivalent UK properties.

faqs.question: Могу ли я получить ипотеку в Испании как иностранец?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain Spanish mortgages through major banks. Typically, banks offer 70-80% financing to foreign applicants with stable income. Interest rates remain competitive with UK mortgages. Most banks require proof of income, credit history, and employment stability. Having an NIE number simplifies the process considerably.

faqs.question: Какова стоимость жизни на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Pilar de La Horadada is significantly lower than UK equivalents—approximately 20-30% cheaper overall. Groceries, utilities, dining, and entertainment all cost less. Healthcare through private clinics remains affordable. Fuel costs are substantially lower than UK prices. Families relocating typically report stretching budgets further while maintaining or improving quality of life.

faqs.question: Является ли Коста-Бланка хорошим местом для покупки недвижимости?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is an excellent property market. The region has experienced consistent 8% year-on-year appreciation, established infrastructure supports modern living, and a substantial expat community provides support networks. Climate, beaches, and outdoor lifestyle make it attractive for families and retirees. Diversified rental opportunities provide additional income for investors.

faqs.question: Какая погода на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually with mild winters and warm summers. Average temperatures range from 10-12°C in winter to 28-30°C in summer. Rainfall is minimal, typically 250-300mm annually. The Mediterranean climate is ideal for outdoor family activities, beach visits, and golf year-round. Most families consider the weather one of the strongest lifestyle advantages.

faqs.question: Is this property suitable for families with young children?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. This villa is ideally designed for families—three bedrooms provide individual space, three bathrooms eliminate morning conflicts, and the 255-square-meter plot offers secure outdoor play areas. Pilar de La Horadada is a family-friendly community with safe neighborhoods, nearby schools, excellent healthcare, and beaches for weekend activities. The established expat community provides family support networks.
